00031 namespace pciDriver {
00032         class KernelMemory;
00033         class UserMemory;

00037 namespace mprace {
00038 
00039 class Board;
00040 
00048 class DMABuffer {
00049         friend class DMAEngine;
00050         friend class DMAEngineWG;
00051 public:
00055         enum MemType { 
00056                 KERNEL,                 //>** Kernel Memory
00057                 KERNEL_PIECES,  //>** Kernel with descriptors, used for debugging
00058                 USER                    //>** User Memory
00059         };
00060         
00071         DMABuffer(Board& board, const unsigned int size, MemType type, unsigned int kernel_pieces=1 );
00072 
00082         DMABuffer(Board& board, const unsigned int size, unsigned int *ptr);
00083 
00088         ~DMABuffer();
00089         
00095         inline unsigned int *getPointer() { return buf; }
00096 
00100         inline unsigned int size() const { return _size; }
00101         
00108         inline unsigned int& operator[](const unsigned int index)
00109                 { return buf[index]; }
00110 
00114         inline MemType getType() const { return type; };
00115 
00119         inline void *getDescriptorsPtr() { return descriptors; };
00120 
00121 private:
00122         MemType type;                   //**> The type of the memory used by the buffer
00123         unsigned int _size;             //**> Size of the memory, in bytes
00124         unsigned int *buf;              //**> Pointer in userspace to access the buffer area
00125         bool ownsMem;                   //**> Whatever the buffer owns the memory or not.
00126         unsigned int kernel_pieces;
00127 
00128         Board& board;
00129 
00130         // These are implementation dependent. For PCIDriver only.
00131         pciDriver::KernelMemory *kBuf;  //**> Associated Kernel Buffer, if using a PCIDriver
00132         pciDriver::UserMemory *uBuf;    //**> Associated User Buffer, if using a PCIDriver
00133         pciDriver::KernelMemory *kBuf_descriptors;      //**> Associated Kernel Buffer to store the descriptors, if using a PCIDriver
00134         
00135         void *descriptors;                              //**> Pointer to the descriptors array.
00136                 
00137 }; /* class DMABuffer */
00138 
00139 } /* namespace mprace */
